titleStmt.title: B. F. Bowen and Willis Collins to Unknown
CWG10208

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Ruddells Mills Bourbon Co Ky
To the Judge of the Bourbon County Court

Dr Sir we the undersigned Justices of the peace having been the Examining Court in the case of the commonwealth of Ky against Alfred A Slave the property of J. Shawhan of Harrison County Ky for the murder of Andy a Slave the property of Daniel Shawhan of this county having heard the Evidence are of opinion that there ^are^ reasonable grounds to suppose that he Alfred acted in Self defence and it would give general Satisfaction to this community for the Boy Alfred to be Sold and Sent from this State if it can be done at this time, and Daniel Shawhan the owner of the Boy that was killed wishes him released and sent out of the State given under our hands this the 12th day of March 1861

B. F. Bowen, J. P. B. C.
Willis D. Collins
